description.S1: Gladys has given you a copy of a distress signal from Terra 2.
description.S2: Someone in Roseway, a supposedly abandoned Auntie Cleo outpost, is requesting help.
description.S3: If there are corporate operations hiding there, it's likely you'll be able to find some valuable data to sell back to Gladys.

blurb.B1: You obtain this quest if you ask Gladys to detail her opportunity when looking for a Nav Key during Passage to Anywhere.
blurb.B2: You will be asked listen to a Distress Call

O1.summary: View the distress signal recording on your ship

description.S1: The distress signal has nav coordinates embedded in it.
description.S2: Play it on your ship so that ADA can get to the Roseway landing pad

blurb.B1: Once you can use the ship, go to ADA and ask her to play the Distress Call.
blurb.B2: You will receive 2000 XP and unlock the quest The Doom That Came to Roseway.
blurb.B3: You will now also be able to travel to Roseway in Terra 2.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I wanted to talk about that "opportunity" you mentioned.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Yes, dearie?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm ready to look into it.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Thanks for your time.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Ain't that just a treat. So, you know Edna, over in Engineering? On occasion, she'll pass along transmissions I might find interesting.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: She sent me a recording of a distress signal she'd scraped from the Groundbreaker's comm array.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Curious thing is, it came from an outpost called Roseway, and Auntie Cleo abandoned that place years ago.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Say no more. I'm in.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why was Roseway abandoned?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Maybe it's some sort of automated message.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: You've got an ear for intrigue and a nose for bits. I like that. Here's a copy of the SOS recording.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Um... Dear me, I had it right here a moment ago.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Goodness, I've no idea where it's gone. And I had Edna wipe the logs so no one else could find out about it, too. I'm sorry for wasting your time.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Let me see what you've got for sale.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Can't say I know for sure. Maybe it never really was.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Those corps are cleverer than all get-out - might've been a ruse to keep the rest of the Board from sniffing around.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Edna didn't seem to think so, and I trust the dear girl's judgment - well, maybe not in men, but she knows her comms. So like as not, someone's been down there recently.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: And if someone's set up shop in Roseway, I'd wager they got something to hide.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If it's a corporate town with something to hide, why the SOS?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sounds like an "opportunity," all right.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: If they're hiding something, won't they be liable to shoot on sight?

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Maybe whatever they're hiding went to heck, and now they need a few spare hands to clean up the mess.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: If you should find a secret worth selling, might be I could find a buyer. Corporate bigwigs'll pay top bit for inside information on their competitors.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: The more we got the corps fightin' each other, the less time they got to meddle in our affairs.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: So you need someone to snoop around for you?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: My services don't come cheap.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: My goodness, aren't you quick on the uptake. I like that.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Should you find yourself responding to a certain distress call, and in so doing find yourself in possession of certain valuable corporate secrets, well...

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Then we ought to have a chat over a pot of tea and my famous cookies.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You can count on me!

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll stop by if I find anything.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: This sounds shady. No thanks.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Law bless your atoms. Here's a copy of the SOS recording complete with the coordinates.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Don't forget to come find old Gladys when you're done.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: We don't all have the stomach for skulduggery - I understand. Be a dear and come see me again if you change your mind.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Well, I find I'm in need of a ship captain with a little... moral flexibility? Might be this could help out the Groundbreaker, as well as earn some bits. But if you've got qualms...

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: No qualms here. Let's hear the details.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Do you know Edna, over in Engineering? Sweet as a pea, that one. On occasion, she'll pass along transmissions I might find interesting.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Neither do mine, dearie. Old Gladys knows the value of good work. You'll be compensated accordingly, I can promise you that.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: I appreciate a man who knows one when he hears it.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Quite the opposite, I believe. Nothing terribly secret about gunfire, is there?

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Any time, sweetheart. You know where to find me. Here, take a candy with you.

dialog.speaker: GladysCulkelly (Female)
dialog.utterance: Any time, sweetheart. You know where to find me.
